column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to [[Nevill Coghill]]'''.

column1: *'''Subject:''' [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] have stated that: "[[Nevill Coghill]] had written to Tolkien asking for explanations
column2: some of which the author felt should be left until the later volumes of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' appeared and his friend was able to read them". Tolkien did
column4: offer some comments about [[Tom Bombadil]] in his letter.<ref name=WC>{{webcite|author=[[Wayne G. Hammond]]

column1: *'''Publication:''' A section from the letter was published in [http://wayneandchristina.wordpress.com/2014/12/30/tom-bombadil-addenda-corrigenda/ a blog post] by [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]].<ref name=WC/>
